</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<B>
	AU OPTRONICS CORP. AND SUBSIDIARIES
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 12PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<B>
	Notes to Consolidated Financial Statements
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<!-- FIELD: /PAGE -->
<P STYLE="FONT: 11PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 21.35PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 11PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 21.35PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	AETJ
	decided to sell its use right of land and plants to Tianjin Binhai Hi-tech Development Area Asset Management Ltd. pursuant to
	the resolution of AETJ&rsquo;s board of directors&rsquo; meeting held on December 9, 2015. The carrying amount of the aforementioned
	assets was $702,390 thousand and the anticipated selling price was approximately $762,091 thousand. The assets were classified
	as noncurrent assets held for sale in the consolidated statement of financial position as of December 31, 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 11PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 21.35PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 11PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 21.35PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	The
	Company recognized an impairment loss of $172,530 thousand in the fourth quarter of 2015 for certain machineries and equipments
	with low utilization in display segment resulting from the decline in the application for certain products.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 11PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 21.35PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 11PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 21.35PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	Some
	indications of impairment existed in the Company&rsquo;s solar segment; therefore, the Company performed its impairment assessment
	over the solar CGU&rsquo;s long-term assets with lower capacity utilization. In 2015, 2014 and 2013, the Company wrote down its
	property, plant and equipment and recognized losses of $101,764 thousand, $2,296,081 thousand and $159,532 thousand, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 11PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 21.35PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 11PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 21.35PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	Polysilicon
	in the solar industry has experienced significant downturns including sharp decline in pricing because of oversupply capacity
	worldwide and reductions in government economic incentives; therefore, the management of M.Setek, the Company&rsquo;s subsidiary
	in Japan, decided to cease the production of polysilicon which was approved by the board of directors of M.Setek on January 8,
	2016. The Company performed its impairment assessment over the polysilicon CGU&rsquo;s long-term assets in the fourth quarter
	of 2015. The recoverable amount was determined based on the relevant assets&rsquo; estimated fair value less cost of disposal.
	The fair value of long-term assets was determined by management with reference to the sales prices of recent transactions of similar
	asset in the same geographical area.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 11PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 21.35PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 11PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 21.35PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	The
	fair value measurement was categorised as a Level 3 fair value based on inputs in the valuation techniques used.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 11PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 21.35PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 11PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 21.35PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	The
	following table shows the valuation technique used in the determination of fair value of the polysilicon CGU&rsquo;s long-term
	assets within Level 3, as well as the significant inputs used in the valuation model.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 11PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 21.35PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 11PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 21.35PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_70"></A>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 95%; BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 42%; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 1PT SOLID">
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<B>
	Description of
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<B>
	Valuation Technique
</B>
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 1%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; FONT-SIZE: 12PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 25%; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 1PT SOLID; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM">
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<B>
	Significant inputs
</B>
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 1%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; FONT-SIZE: 12PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 31%; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 1PT SOLID; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; FONT-SIZE: 12PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<B>
	Inter-relationship between significant inputs and fair value measurement
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<B>
	Sales comparison approach
</B>
	:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Sales price of comparable property in
	close proximity are adjusted for differences in key attributes such as property size. The expected sales price is
	adjusted with sales discount based on land size. The significant inputs into this valuation approach are price per
	square meter of comparable properties and sales discount.
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-SIZE: 12PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 13.6PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: -13PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: WINGDINGS">
	l
</FONT>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Price
	per square meter (JPY 8,000).
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 13.6PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: -13PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: WINGDINGS">
	l
</FONT>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Sales
	discount (15%).
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-SIZE: 12PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 1.2PT 0PT 0.65PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The estimated fair value
	would increase (decrease) if:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 1.2PT 0PT 14.9PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: -14.2PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: WINGDINGS">
	l
</FONT>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;the
	price per square meter is higher (lower); or
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 1.2PT 0PT 14.9PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: -14.2PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: WINGDINGS">
	l
</FONT>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;the sales discount rates are lower (higher).
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<BR STYLE="CLEAR: BOTH">
<P STYLE="FONT: 11PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 21.35PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 11PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 21.35PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">

</TABLE>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<B>
	AU OPTRONICS CORP. AND SUBSIDIARIES
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 12PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<B>
	Notes to Consolidated Financial Statements
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<!-- FIELD: /PAGE -->
<P STYLE="FONT: 11PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 21.35PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 11PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 21.35PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 11PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 21.35PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	Based
	on management assessment, the carrying amount of the polysilicon CGU was determined to be higher than its estimated recoverable
	amount; consequently, an impairment loss of $6,755,157 thousand was recognized during the year ended December 31, 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 11PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 21.35PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 11PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 21.35PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	Impairment
	losses as mentioned above are recognized as other gains and losses in the consolidated statements of comprehensive income.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 11PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 21.35PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 11PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 21.35PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	The
	capitalized borrowing costs were $186,025 thousand, $210,882 thousand and $241,286 thousand for the years ended December 31, 2015,
	2014 and 2013, respectively. The interest rates applied for the capitalization, ranged from 1.29% to 6.73%, 1.00% to 6.89% and
	0.61% to 6.90% for the years ended December 31, 2015, 2014 and 2013, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 11PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 21.35PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>

<FONT STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	Certain
	property, plant and equipment were pledged as collateral, see note 37.
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE="FONT: 11PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 21.35PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 11PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 21.35PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	AUO
	decided to sell all its plants and land located in Jhunan, Taiwan to Lextar on August 13, 2014. The transfer was completed in
	November 2014 and the selling price and gain on disposal were $1,061,297 thousand and $279,729 thousand, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 11PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 21.35PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">

<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE; WIDTH: 100%">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 100%">

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<B>
	AU OPTRONICS CORP. AND SUBSIDIARIES
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 12PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<B>
	Notes to Consolidated Financial Statements
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<!-- FIELD: /PAGE -->
<P STYLE="FONT: 11PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 21.35PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 11PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 21.35PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	The
	fair value of investment property is based on a valuation performed by an independent valuer who holds a recognized and relevant
	professional qualification and has recent experience in the location and category of the investment property being valued. The
	fair value measurement has been categorized as a level 3 fair value based on the inputs to the valuation techniques used.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 11PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 21.35PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 11PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 21.35PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	For
	the year ended December 31, 2014, valuation techniques are based on the market valuation approach and income approach. Market
	valuation approach is through comparison, analysis, adjustment and other means of value for comparable properties to estimate
	the value of the investment property; the income approach is based on the discounted cash flows from the Company&rsquo;s estimated
	future rentals.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 11PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 21.35PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 11PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 21.35PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	For
	the year ended December 31, 2015, valuation techniques are based on the market valuation approach and land development analysis
	approach. Land development analysis approach determine the fair value of investment property based on the value prior to development
	or construction, after deducting the direct cost, indirect cost, capital interest and profit during the development period, and
	also consider total sales price of properties after completion of development or construction. It also incorporates the possibility
	of changes in utility of land through development or improvement in accordance with legal use and density of the land.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 11PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 21.35PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 11PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 21.35PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	The
	significant inputs in valuation techniques used are set out below.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 11PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 21.35PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<B>
	Convertible
	Bonds Payable
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 11PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
<FONT STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 11PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 21.35PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	AUO
	issued unsecured overseas convertible corporate bonds (hereinafter referred to as &ldquo;ECB 4&rdquo;) on October 13, 2010 with
	par value of US$800,000 thousand and coupon rate at 0%. The duration period is five years commencing from the issuance date.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 11PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 21.35PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 11PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 21.35PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 11PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 21.35PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 11PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 45.5PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE="FONT: 11PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 21.35PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">

	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 11PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 21.35PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	AUO
	purchased the outstanding ECB 4 starting from 2011. In 2015, 2014 and 2013, AUO purchased the outstanding ECB 4 with par value
	of US$399,700 thousand, US$180,800 thousand and US$105,000 thousand, respectively, at costs of US$461,015 thousand, US$198,519
	thousand and US$105,533 thousand, respectively. The remaining outstanding balance of ECB 4 with par value of US$14,500 thousand
	was fully redeemed by AUO at the redemption price equal to 115.34% of the remaining par value of ECB4 on the maturity date of
	October 13, 2015, with no exercise of conversion rights.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 11PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 21.35PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;

	Convertible
	bonds payable as of December 31, 2015 and 2014 consisted of the following:
</FONT>

<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_77"></A>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; WIDTH: 95%; BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 23%; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-SIZE: 11PT; LAYOUT-GRID-MODE: CHAR">
<FONT STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	Conversion
	method
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 77%; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-SIZE: 11PT; LAYOUT-GRID-MODE: CHAR">
<FONT STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	Bondholders
	may, at any time from 41 days after issuance to 10 days before maturity, convert ECB4 into common shares or ADSs of the Company.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-SIZE: 11PT; LAYOUT-GRID-MODE: CHAR">
<FONT STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	Conversion
	price
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-SIZE: 11PT; LAYOUT-GRID-MODE: CHAR">
<FONT STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	Original
	price at NT$40.74.&nbsp;&nbsp;The conversion price was adjusted to NT$38.04 as a result of earnings distributions, as approved
	by shareholders on June 2, 2015.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-SIZE: 11PT; LAYOUT-GRID-MODE: CHAR">
<FONT STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	Exchange
	rate
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-SIZE: 11PT; LAYOUT-GRID-MODE: CHAR">
<FONT STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	US$:NT$
	exchange rate of NT$30.778 / US$1.00
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-SIZE: 11PT; LAYOUT-GRID-MODE: CHAR">
<FONT STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	Redemption
	terms
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-SIZE: 11PT; LAYOUT-GRID-MODE: CHAR">
<FONT STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	Unless
	previously redeemed, purchased and cancelled, or converted, bonds are redeemable on maturity at a redemption price equal to
	115.34% of the unpaid principal amount thereof (redemption rate on maturity is 2.875%, calculated semi-annually).
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>

	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; WIDTH: 95%; BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-SIZE: 11PT; LAYOUT-GRID-MODE: CHAR; WIDTH: 23%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 77%">
<P STYLE="FONT: 11PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 18.6PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: -18.6PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	(a)&#9;&nbsp;&nbsp;Effective
	from the third anniversary of issuance, AUO may, redeem the outstanding bonds at the early redemption amount, in whole
	or in part, if the closing price (translated into U.S. dollars at the prevailing rate) of its common shares on the Taiwan
	Stock Exchange is at least 130% of the conversion price for a period of 20 out of 30 consecutive trading days.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 11PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 18.6PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: -18.6PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 11PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 18.6PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: -18.6PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	(b)&#9;&nbsp;&nbsp;AUO
	may redeem the total amount of outstanding bonds in whole at the early redemption amount in the event that 90% of the
	bonds have been previously redeemed, converted, or purchased and cancelled.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 11PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 18.6PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: -18.6PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 11PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 16.95PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: -16.95PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	(c)&#9;&nbsp;&nbsp;AUO
	may redeem the total amount of outstanding bonds in whole at the early redemption amount if as a result of certain changes
	relating to the tax laws in the ROC or such other jurisdiction in which AUO is then organized, AUO is required to pay
	additional amounts.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 11PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 16.95PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: -16.95PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-SIZE: 11PT; LAYOUT-GRID-MODE: CHAR">
<FONT STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	Repurchase
	terms
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
<P STYLE="FONT: 11PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 18.6PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: -18.6PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	(a)&#9;&nbsp;&nbsp;Bondholders
	bear the right to request AUO to repurchase bonds, in whole or in part, at the early redemption amount in the event that
	AUO&rsquo;s common shares cease to be listed or admitted to trading on the Taiwan Stock Exchange (temporary suspension
	of trading of AUO&rsquo;s common shares on the Taiwan Stock Exchange in accordance with the regulations of the Taiwan
	Stock Exchange is excluded).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 11PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 18.6PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: -18.6PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 11PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 18.6PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: -18.6PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	(b)&#9;&nbsp;&nbsp;Bondholders
	bear the right to request AUO to repurchase bonds, in whole or in part, at the early redemption amount when one or more persons,
	acting in concert, acquire legal or beneficial ownership of over 50% of AUO&rsquo;s capital stock. A &ldquo;person&rdquo; aforementioned
	does not include AUO&rsquo;s directors and AUO&rsquo;s majority-owned direct or indirect subsidiaries.&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<BR STYLE="CLEAR: BOTH">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0">
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 11PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 45.5PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
</FONT>
</P>
<!-- FIELD: PAGE; SEQUENCE: 154 -->

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	(Continued)
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE="FONT: 11PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 21.35PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 11PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0PT 0PT 21.25PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	The
	Company entered into the aforementioned long-term loan arrangements with banks and financial institutions to finance capital expenditures
	on construction projects and the purchase of machinery and equipment. A commitment fee is negotiated with the leading banks of
	syndicated loans, and is calculated based on the committed-to-withdraw but unused balance, if any. No commitment fees were paid
	for the year ended December 31, 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 11PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 21.35PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 11PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0PT 0PT 21.25PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	These
	credit facilities contain covenants that require the Company to maintain certain financial ratios, calculating based on the Company&rsquo;s
	annual consolidated financial statements prepared in accordance with Taiwan Financial Reporting Standards, such as current ratio
	(defined as current assets divided by current liabilities excluding (a) current portion of long-term debt or (b) current portion
	of long-term debt and equipment and construction payable), leverage ratio (calculated as the sum of short-term borrowings plus
	current portion of long-term debt and long-term debt to consolidated tangible net worth), interest coverage ratio, tangible net
	worth and others as specified in the loan agreements.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 11PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 21.35PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 11PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 21.35PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<B>
	AU OPTRONICS CORP. AND SUBSIDIARIES
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 12PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<B>
	Notes to Consolidated Financial Statements
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<!-- FIELD: /PAGE -->
<P STYLE="FONT: 11PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 21.35PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 11PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 21.35PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	As
	of December 31, 2015, AUO was in compliance with the covenants under each of the loan agreements except for one of AUO&rsquo;s
	subsidiaries which failed to comply with tangible net worth covenants in its loan agreements. Failure to comply with financial
	covenants is not considered an event of default under the loan agreements and therefore the loans are not callable by the banks
	unless a resolution is made by the banks to call the loans or there is a refusal to grant a waiver of the covenants by a majority
	of the banks and financial institutions. As of December 31, 2015, there was no such event of default on the aforementioned long-term
	borrowings. Consequently, these loans are still classified as noncurrent liabilities as of December 31, 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 11PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 21.35PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 11PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 21.35PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	As
	of December 31, 2014, one of AUO&rsquo;s subsidiaries failed to comply with the interest coverage ratio covenants in its loan
	agreements. Failure to comply with financial covenants is not considered an event of default under the loan agreements and therefore
	the loans are not callable by the banks unless a resolution is made by the banks to call the loans or there is a refusal to grant
	a waiver of the covenants by a majority of the banks and financial institutions. As of December 31, 2014, there was no such event
	of default on the aforementioned long-term borrowings. Consequently, these loans are still classified as noncurrent liabilities
	as of December 31, 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 11PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 21.35PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 11PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 21.35PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	Refer
	to note 34 for detailed information of exposures to interest rate, currency, and liquidity risk. Refer to note 37 for assets pledged
	as collateral to secure the aforementioned long-term borrowings.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 11PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 21.35PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>

	The provisions for warranties
	were estimated based on historical experience of warranty claims rate associated with similar products and services. The Company
	expects most warranty claims will be made within two years from the date of the sale of the product.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 45.5PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">

<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE; WIDTH: 100%">

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<B>
	AU OPTRONICS CORP. AND SUBSIDIARIES
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 12PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<B>
	Notes to Consolidated Financial Statements
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<!-- FIELD: /PAGE -->
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 45.5PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 45.5PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	AUO entered into various operating
	lease agreements for land with Hsinchu Science Park Administration Bureaus beginning from March 1, 1994 for a period of 20 years,
	with renewal option upon expiration. AUO had on July 2003 and November 2006, entered into various operating lease for land with
	Central Science Park Administration Bureaus for period from July 28, 2003 till December 31, 2023 and November 9, 2006 till December
	31, 2025. All lease amounts are adjusted in accordance with the land value fixed by the government from time to time.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 45.5PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 45.5PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	AUO had also on February 2008
	renewed its lease agreement with Hsinchu Science Park for the land in Longtan Science Park. The period covers from February 9,
	2008 till December 31, 2027. The lease amount is adjusted in accordance with the land value fixed by the government from time to
	time.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 45.5PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 45.5PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	In addition, the Company&rsquo;s
	subsidiaries, including CFI, ACTW, DPTW, AUCZ and M.Setek, also entered into operating lease agreements for operating facilities
	and land for periods from April 13, 2009 to December 31, 2030.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 45.5PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 45.5PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Rental expense for operating
	leases amounted to $1,115,570 thousand, $1,143,750 thousand and $1,188,582 thousand for the years ended December 31, 2015, 2014
	and 2013, respectively.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 45.5PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 45.5PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The Company&rsquo;s subsidiaries
	in China have obtained the land use rights which were recognized as long-term prepaid rents.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 45.5PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 24PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 22PT">
	(b)
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Lessor
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 45.5PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The Company leased its investment
	properties to third parties under operating lease. Refer to note 14 for further information on investment properties.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 45.5PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 45.5PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Non-cancellable lease receivables
	as of December 31, 2015 and 2014, were as follows:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 45.5PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_82"></A>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE; WIDTH: 90%; FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 45.5PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM">
<TD STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; PADDING-LEFT: 0.25IN; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; PADDING-BOTTOM: 1PT; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD COLSPAN="7" STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 1PT SOLID">
	December 31,
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM">
<TD STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; PADDING-LEFT: 0.25IN; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	&nbsp;

	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD COLSPAN="3" STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 1PT SOLID">

<FONT STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<B>
	AU OPTRONICS CORP. AND SUBSIDIARIES

<P STYLE="FONT: 12PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">

	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: BOLD 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.25PT">
	22.
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Employee Benefits
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 24PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 22PT">
	(a)
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Defined benefit plans
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 45.5PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Pursuant to the ROC Labor Standards
	Law, AUO, DPTW and CFI have established defined benefit pension plans covering their full-time employees in the ROC. These plans
	provide for retirement benefits to retiring employees based on years of service and the average salary for the six-month period
	before the employee&rsquo;s retirement. The funding of these retirement plans by the companies is based on a certain percentage
	of employees&rsquo; total salaries. The funds are deposited with Bank of Taiwan.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 45.5PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 45.5PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	M.Setek has established defined
	benefit pension plans providing for retirement benefits to retiring employees based on years of service, position, and certain
	other factors in accordance with the regulations of its country of establishment.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 45.5PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">

<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 46.2PT">
</TD>

	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 46.2PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
	(3)
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Plan assets
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 63.7PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	AUO, DPTW and CFI contribute
	an amount based on a certain percentage of employees&rsquo; total salaries paid every month to their respective pension funds (the
	&ldquo;Funds&rdquo;), which are administered by the Bureau of Labor Fund, Ministry of Labor and supervised by the Labor Pension
	Fund Supervisory Committee (the &ldquo;Committee&rdquo;) and deposited in the Committee&rsquo;s name with Bank of Taiwan. Under
	the ROC Labor Standards Law, the minimum return on the plan assets should not be lower than the average interest rate on two-year
	time deposits published by the local banks. The government is not only responsible for the determination of the investment strategies
	and policies, but also for any shortfall in the event that the rate of return is less than the required rate of return. As of the
	reporting date, the Funds deposited in the Committee&rsquo;s name in the Bank of Taiwan amounted to $2,058,417 thousand. Information
	on utilization of labor pension funds, including the yield rate of funds and the component of plan assets are available at the
	Bureau of Labor Funds, Ministry of Labor website.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 63.7PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 63.7PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Under the defined benefit plans
	in Japan, M.Setek is responsible to pay to employees when they are retired.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 63.7PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;

<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 92.05PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;

<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 92.05PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	As at December 31, 2015, the
	weighted-average duration of the defined benefit obligation was between nine years to twenty two years.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 92.05PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 91.9PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The Company anticipates contributing
	$105,093 thousand to the defined benefit plans in the next year starting from January 1, 2016.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 91.9PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 68.4PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 23.55PT">
	(ii)
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Sensitivity analysis
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 92.05PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	When measuring the present
	value of defined benefit obligation, the Company shall make judgments and estimates to determine the relevant actuarial assumptions,
	including discount rate, rate of increase in future salary and etc., at each reporting date. Any changes in the actuarial assumptions
	may have significant effect on the Company&rsquo;s defined benefit obligation.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 92.05PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 92.05PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Reasonably possible changes
	at December 31, 2015 to one of the relevant actuarial assumptions, holding other assumptions constant, would have affected the
	defined benefit obligation by the amounts shown below.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 92.05PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>

	(146,656

<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 1%; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 2.5PT DOUBLE; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	)
</TD>

	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 8%; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 2.5PT DOUBLE; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT">
	156,049
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 1%; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 2.5PT DOUBLE; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; PADDING-BOTTOM: 2.5PT">
	Rate of increase in future salary
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; PADDING-BOTTOM: 2.5PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>

	$
</TD>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 2.5PT DOUBLE; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT">
	154,530
</TD>

</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 92.05PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 92.05PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	In practical, the relevant
	actuarial assumptions are correlated to each other. The approach to develop the sensitivity analysis as above is the same approach
	to recognize the net defined benefit liability in the statement of financial position. The approach to develop the sensitivity
	analysis and its relevant actuarial assumptions are the same as those in previous year.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 92.05PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: ALWAYS; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE; WIDTH: 100%">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 100%">
<A HREF="#DP64167_20F_HTM_TOC" STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
<A HREF="#DP64167_20F_HTM_TOC" STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	Table of Contents

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<B>
	AU OPTRONICS CORP. AND SUBSIDIARIES
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 12PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<B>
	Notes to Consolidated Financial Statements
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<!-- FIELD: /PAGE -->
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 24PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 22PT">
	(b)
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Defined contribution plans
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 45.5PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Commencing July 1, 2005, pursuant
	to the ROC Labor Pension Act (the &ldquo;Act&rdquo;), employees who elected to participate in the Act or joined the Company after
	July 1, 2005, are subject to a defined contribution plan under the Act. Under the defined contribution plan, AUO and its subsidiaries
	located in the ROC contribute monthly at a rate of no less than six percent of an employee&rsquo;s monthly salary to the employee&rsquo;s
	individual pension fund account at the ROC Bureau of Labor Insurance. The Company&rsquo;s foreign subsidiaries have set up their
	retirement plans, if necessary, based on their respective local government regulations.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 45.5PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 45.5PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	AUO and its subsidiaries in
	the ROC have set up defined contribution plans in accordance with the Act. For the years ended December 31, 2015, 2014 and 2013,
	these companies set aside $927,083 thousand, $873,889 thousand and $849,342 thousand, respectively, of the pension costs under
	the pension plan to the ROC Bureau of the Labour Insurance. Except for the aforementioned companies, other foreign subsidiaries
	recognized pension expenses of $1,400,994 thousand, $1,276,125 thousand and $1,030,424 thousand for the years ended December 31,
	2015, 2014 and 2013, respectively, for the defined contribution plans based on their respective local government regulations.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 45.5PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: BOLD 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.25PT">
	23.
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Capital and Other Components of Equity
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 24PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 22PT">
	(a)
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Common stock
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 45.5PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	AUO&rsquo;s authorized common
	stock, with par value of $10 per share, both amounted to $100,000,000 thousand as of December 31, 2015 and 2014.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 45.5PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 45.5PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	AUO&rsquo;s issued and outstanding
	common stock, with par value of $10 per share, both amounted to $96,242,451 thousand as of December 31, 2015 and 2014.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 45.5PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 45.5PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	AUO&rsquo;s ADSs were listed
	on the New York Stock Exchange. Each ADS represents 10 shares of common stock. As of December 31, 2015, AUO had issued 78,096 thousand
	ADSs, which represented 780,965 thousand shares of its common stock.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 45.5PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">

	Balance of capital surplus as
	of December 31, 2015 and 2014 were as follows:

<A NAME="eolPage164"></A>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: ALWAYS; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE; WIDTH: 100%">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 100%">
<A HREF="#DP64167_20F_HTM_TOC" STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
<A HREF="#DP64167_20F_HTM_TOC" STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</A>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<B>
	AU OPTRONICS CORP. AND SUBSIDIARIES
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 12PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<B>
	Notes to Consolidated Financial Statements
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<!-- FIELD: /PAGE -->
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 45.5PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 45.5PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	According to the ROC Company
	Act, capital surplus, including premium from stock issuing and donations received, shall be applied to offset accumulated deficits
	before it can be used to increase common stock or distribute cash. Pursuant to the ROC Regulations Governing the Offering and Issuance
	of Securities by Securities Issuers, the total sum of capital surplus capitalized per annum shall not exceed 10 percent of the
	paid-in capital.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 45.5PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 24PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 22PT">
	(c)
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Legal reserve
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 45.5PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	According to the ROC Company
	Act, 10 percent of the annual earnings after payment of income taxes due and offsetting accumulated deficits, if any, shall be
	allocated as legal reserve until the accumulated legal reserve equals the issued common stock. When a company incurs no loss, it
	may, pursuant to a resolution to be adopted by a shareholders' meeting, distribute its legal reserve by issuing new shares or by
	cash, only the portion of legal reserve which exceeds 25 percent of the paid-in capital may be distributed.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 45.5PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 24PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 22PT">
	(d)
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Distribution of earnings and dividend policy
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 45.5PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	According to AUO&rsquo;s Articles
	of Incorporation, 10 percent of the annual earnings, after payment of income taxes due and offsetting accumulated deficits, if
	any, shall be set aside as a legal reserve. In addition, a special reserve in accordance with applicable laws and regulations shall
	also be set aside. The remaining earnings may be distributed as follows:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 45.5PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 46.2PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 17.6PT">
	(1)
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	profit sharing to employees: no less than 5 percent;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 46.2PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 17.6PT">
	(2)
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	remuneration of directors: no more than 1 percent; and
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 46.2PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 17.6PT">
	(3)
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	all or a portion of the remaining balance shall be distributed as shareholders&rsquo; dividends.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 45.5PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Pursuant to relevant laws or
	regulations or as requested by the local authority, a special reserve equivalent to the total amount of items that are accounted
	for as deductions to the equity shall be set aside from current earnings, and not distributed. The special reserve shall be made
	available for appropriation to the extent of reversal of deductions to equity in subsequent periods.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 45.5PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 45.5PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="COLOR: WINDOWTEXT">
	AUO
</FONT>
	&rsquo;s
<FONT STYLE="COLOR: WINDOWTEXT">
	dividend policy is to pay dividends from surplus considering factors such as AUO
</FONT>
	&rsquo;s
<FONT STYLE="COLOR: WINDOWTEXT">
	current and future investment environment, cash requirements, competitive conditions and capital budget requirements, and taking
	into account the shareholders
</FONT>
	&rsquo;
<FONT STYLE="COLOR: WINDOWTEXT">
	interest, maintenance of a balanced dividend and AUO
</FONT>
	&rsquo;
<FONT STYLE="COLOR: WINDOWTEXT">
	s
	long term financial plan.
</FONT>
	Earnings distribution is proposed by the board of directors and approved at the shareholders&rsquo;
	meeting. Pursuant to the Articles of Incorporation, the cash dividend shall not be less than 10 percent of the total dividends.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 45.5PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<!-- FIELD: PAGE; SEQUENCE: 163 -->

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	(Continued)
</FONT>
</P>

	&nbsp;

<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 45.5PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	In accordance with the ROC Company
	Act as amended in May 2015, profit sharing to employees and remuneration to directors will no longer be appropriate from current
	year distributable earnings. The amendment of AUO&rsquo;s Articles of Incorporation, pursuant to the amendment of the ROC Company
	Act, was approved in the board of directors&rsquo; meeting held on January 29, 2016, and is to be presented for approval in 2016
	annual shareholders&rsquo; meeting. Please refer to note 26 for further information.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 45.5PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">

	share were as follows:

<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 45.5PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	AUO had on June 6, 2014, through
	its shareholders&rsquo; meeting declared a cash distribution of $0.14 per share, totalling $1,347,395 thousand from its capital
	surplus. At the same time, profit sharing to employees of $564,351 thousand and remuneration to directors of $11,287 thousand were
	also approved through the shareholders&rsquo; meeting. The aforementioned distribution of profit sharing to employees and remuneration
	to directors for 2013 was consistent with the resolutions of the board of directors&rsquo; meeting held on March 11, 2014, and
	the amount has been charged against earnings of 2013.
</P>

	share were as follows:

<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 45.5PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	AUO&rsquo;s appropriations of
	earnings for 2015 have been approved in the meeting of the board of directors held on March 10, 2016. The appropriations and dividends
	per share were as follows:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 45.5PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE; WIDTH: 90%; FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 45.5PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM">
<TD STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; PADDING-BOTTOM: 1PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>

	for 2015 are to be presented for approval in AUO&rsquo;s 2016 annual shareholders&rsquo; meeting.

<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.25PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	(2)
</FONT>
</TD>

	expense recognized on DPTW employee stock options was $956 thousand.

	The
	fair value of the employee stock option granted by DPTW was measured at the date of grant using the Black-Scholes option pricing
	model. The valuation information was as follows:
</FONT>

<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 85.05PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0IN">
	&nbsp;

<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 84.95PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 84.95PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The expected volatility is
	calculated based on the weighted-average historical volatility and adjusted by the expected change due to publicly available information.
	The expected duration of stock option is according to the terms of the plan. The expected dividend rate and risk-free interest
	rate are determined based on the ROC government bonds. When determining the fair value of the stock option, service and non-market
	performance conditions are not taken into consideration.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 84.95PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 63.8PT">

<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 21.35PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 21.35PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Refer to note 39 for further
	revenue information.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 21.35PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 21.35PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; FONT: BOLD 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.25PT">
<P STYLE="FONT: BOLD 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 21.25PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: -21.25PT">
	26.
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<P STYLE="FONT: BOLD 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 21.25PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: -21.25PT">
	Remuneration
	to Employees and Directors
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 21.35PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 21.35PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Pursuant to the ROC Company
	Act as amended in May 2015, a company&rsquo;s articles of incorporation should stipulate a fixed amount or a ratio of annual profit,
	after offsetting accumulated deficits, if any, to be distributed as remuneration to employees. The amendment of AUO&rsquo;s Articles
	of Incorporation, pursuant to the amendment of the ROC Company Act, was approved in the board of directors&rsquo; meeting held
	on January 29, 2016, and is to be presented for approval in 2016 annual shareholders&rsquo; meeting.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 21.35PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 21.35PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	AUO accrues remuneration to
	employees based on certain percentage of the amount calculating by current year profit (profit before income tax excluding remuneration
	to employees and directors) less accumulated deficit. The accrued remuneration to employees was $665,815 thousand for the year
	ended December 31, 2015. Remuneration to directors was estimated based on the amount expected to pay and recognized together with
	the remuneration to employees as costs for sales or expenses. If remuneration to employees is resolved to be distributed in stock,
	the number of shares is determined by dividing the amount of remuneration by the closing price of the shares on the day preceding
	the board of directors&rsquo; meeting. If there is a change in the proposed amounts after the annual consolidated financial statements
	are authorized for issue, the differences are recorded as a change in accounting estimate and treated as an adjustment to next
	year&rsquo;s profit or loss.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 21.35PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 21.35PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Remuneration to
	employees and directors in the amounts of $665,815 thousand and $13,316 thousand in cash for payment in 2015, respectively,
	have been approved in the meeting of board of directors held on March 10, 2016. The aforementioned approved amounts, which
	are the same as the amounts charged against earnings of 2015 are subject to the approval of the related amendments to AUO&rsquo;s
	Articles of Incorporation in 2016 annual shareholders&rsquo; meeting.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 21.35PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 21.35PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The information about AUO&rsquo;s
	remuneration to employees and directors is available at the Market Observation Post System website.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 21.35PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">

	Operating expenses are inclusive of selling and distribution
	expenses, general and administrative expenses and research and development expenses.

	&nbsp;

<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT: BOLD 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0IN">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	31.
</TD>
<TD>
	Income Taxes
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT: BOLD 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 21.25PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: -21.25PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 21.35PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The Company cannot file a consolidated
	tax return under local regulations. Therefore, AUO and its subsidiaries calculate their income taxes liabilities individually on
	a stand-alone basis using the enacted tax rates in their respective tax jurisdictions.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 21.35PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.35PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 24.65PT">
	(a)

	2013 were as follows:

</TR>
</TABLE>

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<B>
	&nbsp;

	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 45.5PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	As of December 31, 2015 and
	2014, the aggregate taxable temporary differences associated with investments in subsidiaries not unrecognized as deferred tax
	liabilities amounted to $673,044 thousand and $259,926 thousand, respectively.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 45.5PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 24PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 22PT">
	(g)
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Assessments by the tax authorities
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 45.5PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	As of December 31, 2015, the
	tax authorities had completed the examination of income tax returns of AUO through 2013.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 45.5PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">

<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 24PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 22PT">
	(h)
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The integrated income tax system
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 45.5PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The balance of the imputation
	credit account of AUO as of December 31, 2015 and 2014 was $4,025,832 thousand and $5,406,946 thousand, respectively.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 45.5PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 45.5PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The estimated and actual creditable
	ratios for distribution of AUO&rsquo;s earnings under Taiwan Financial Reporting Standards of 2015 and 2014 were 23.06% and 22.82%.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 45.5PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 45.5PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The imputation credit allocated
	to shareholders is based on its balance as of the date of the dividend distribution. The estimated creditable ratio may change
	when the actual distribution of the imputation credit is made.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 45.5PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 45.5PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	With amendments of ROC Income
	Tax Act in year 2015, tax creditable ratio for shareholders resident in Taiwan will be reduced by half for dividend distribution
	after January 1, 2015.
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 45.5PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<TD STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 2.5PT DOUBLE; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 2.5PT DOUBLE; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT">
	1.69
</TD>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 2.5PT DOUBLE; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; PADDING-BOTTOM: 2.5PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 2.5PT DOUBLE; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 2.5PT DOUBLE; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT">
	0.40
</TD>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 2.5PT DOUBLE; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 21.35PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0PT 0PT 46PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The ECB 4 was not taken into
	above consideration for the calculation of diluted earnings per share for the years ended December 31, 2014 and 2013 due to its
	anti-dilutive effect.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 21.35PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 49.55PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The carrying amount of the
	Company&rsquo;s non-derivative financial assets
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&#65293;
</FONT>
	current,
	including cash and cash equivalents, receivables/payables (including related parties), other current financial assets, and short-term
	borrowings, were considered to approximate their fair value due to their short-term nature. Except for aforementioned financial
	instruments, the carrying amount and fair value of other financial instruments of the Company as of December 31, 2015 and 2014
	were as follows:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 49.55PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
